bioghist.p: Women's Way of Philadelphia was started "specifically to form a coalition of organizations serving women and women's causes; to improve the quality of life for women and their families; to end violence against women and children in the street, in the home and on the job; to fight discrimination based on sex and sexual preference or orientation, with particular concern for those persons who are victims of multiple discrimination due to their race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, or disability; to educate women to gain and keep control over their bodies and their lives; to help guarantee women full access to economic, educational, social and cultural opportunities; to assist organizations serving women and their families throughout the country to form, raise funds, and develop programs; and to engage in fundraising and such other lawful activities as will contribute to the foregoing purposes."

scopecontent.p: The Women's Way Papers (1975-1995) including records documenting management and committee activities fundraising efforts (campaigns, dinners, concerts, etc.) and fund files (description, applicant, grantees).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of Suzanne Sheehan Becker, President of Women's Way
